comments.author: Michael Becke
comments.body:
Fix applied to 2.0 and HEAD.  Thanks for the tip Sean.

Mike

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Folks, 
Sorry for this confusion. The reference points (used to point) to the correct
section. However, the RFC number was not correct.
RFC 1945 defines version 1.0 of the HTTP spec. It has been superseded by RFC
2616 that defines version 1.1 of the HTTP spec. The reference should read 

The HTTP POST method is defined in section 9.5 of <a
href="http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt">RFC2616</a

Oleg

comments.author: Oleg Kalnichevski
comments.body:
Fix applied to 2.0 and HEAD.

Oleg

description:
"The HTTP POST method is defined in section 9.5 of RFC1945" should read "The
HTTP POST method is defined in section 8.3 of RFC1945"

Change 9.5 to 8.3.
summary: PostMethod Java doc refers to wrong section of RFC1945
